snippet: Analysts predict that when reporting starts in earnest next week, American companies will show the slowest rate of growth in operating earnings in three years.
abstract: Analysts predict that when first-quarter corporate profits season starts in earnest, American companies will show the slowest rate of growth in operating earnings in three years; Standard & Poor's Capital IQ survey forecasts earnings will have grown 0.93 percent in the first quarter, compared with first-quarter 2011.
lead_paragraph: Analysts predict that when reporting starts in earnest next week, American companies will show the slowest rate of growth in operating earnings in three years.

headline.main: Low Growth in Earnings Is Expected
headline.print_headline: Low Growth In Earnings Is Expected
